definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: One is afraid to beat his wife because his wife is likely to lose another of the lost earnings.
sentences.chinese: 其一是不敢打老婆，因为很可能会赔了夫人又丢财。

sentences.english: Please suppress the use of all Phone Banking Services for the above-mentioned Primary Account.
sentences.chinese: 请终止有关上述基本户口所有电话理财服务。

sentences.english: See this report on Caixin Online.
Intangible cultural asset of the system is supported by the"logic reality".
sentences.chinese: 无形文化财的体系是由“现实化的逻辑”支撑的。

sentences.english: In Buddhism, the giving of wealth consists of external and internal wealth.
sentences.chinese: 财布施，在佛法里面又把它分为内财与外财。

sentences.english: Some people you never have to love, love to look at what made a fortune?
sentences.chinese: 有些人你永远不必爱，看哪个谈爱发了财？

sentences.english: Shear Biao to then rob the meaning of wealth.
He trifled a large fortune away in only a few years.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅几年他就浪费掉一大笔钱财。

sentences.english: The President laid out a number of steps for greater fiscal responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 总统展示了几项更大政财责任的步骤。

sentences.english: The UAE was India's biggest trading partner in the 2012-13 fiscal.
sentences.chinese: 13财年度，阿联酋是印度最大的贸易伙伴。

sentences.english: Children suck the mother when they are young, and the father when they are old.
sentences.chinese: 孩子小时吃母亲的奶，老了享受父亲的财。

sentences.english: Children suck mother when they are young , and father when they are old .
sentences.chinese: 孩子小时吃母亲的奶，老了享用父亲的财。

sentences.english: Itgoes first toward relieving the local officials, who get rich on thetragedies of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 都是先救济那些大发国家苦难财的当官的。

sentences.english: All the officers are drunk, many people began to flatter Jiang choi.
sentences.chinese: 众军官都喝得醉醺醺的，不少人就开始吹捧蒋有财。

sentences.english: He amassed a fortune by speculating on the stock exchange.
sentences.chinese: 他靠证券交易投机聚敛了一大笔钱财。

sentences.english: Teenagers make a fortune on Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 青少年在农历新年时都会发一笔财。

definition: to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lit. inviting wealth/We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])
Mandate of Heaven/the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC/usually written 大運河|大运河[Da4 Yun4 he2]
